learning_objective: Represent data using multiple encoding schemes.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Alex is studying the effects of different soil and water management techniques on crop yield. They collected data on the crop yield (in tonnes) for each technique: 1) Natural 2) Organic manure 3) Chemical fertilizers 4) Combination of organic and chemical. Which of the following coding techniques could Alex use to represent this data graphically for a report?",
    "Answer1": "Encode the data in binary and display a binary tree",
    "Answer2": "Encode the data as numerical values and create a pie chart",
    "Answer3": "Encode the data as strings and create a histogram",
    "Answer4": "Encode the data into Morse code and create a line graph",
    "CorrectAnswer": "2",
    "Explanation": "Encoding the data as numerical values is the best option out of the given, as it allows the direct creation of a pie chart which can effectively compare the crop yields of each technique. The other encoding schemes do not lend themselves to graphical representation for this type of data."
}
